title: Sheet Rubber
content:
EPDM, Nitrile, Silicone, Neoprene and more, Custom Converted To Your Specifications

Sheet Rubber materials are used for Gasketing, Cushioning, Sealing, Sound Damping and many other applications. From applications requiring resistance to oil and solvents, abrasion and flex cracking, ozone and sunlight, heat, water, and steam, to products that require excellent tear strength, vibration damping, temperature specifications, and compression set. SRP most certainly has the right type of sheet rubber to fit your application. Using our advanced laminating system, Pressure Sensitive Adhesive can be applied to all materials.

SRP stocks many of the sheet rubber materials in a variety thicknesses and durometers. We will work with your team to ensure you are choosing the right material for your specific application. If you require any material sampling, or prototyping services for testing in your application, we will work hard with your team to get you what you need in a timely fashion. We base our success on the quality of the product and the customer service we bring to the table.

Sheet Rubber Materials Commonly Converted at SRP

  • Neoprene
  • Silicone
  • Nitrile (Buna-N)
  • EPDM
  • Butyl
  • NorsealÂ® Silicone
  • SBR
  • Thermoplastic Elastomer
  • Natural Rubber
  • Fluoroelastomer
  • Cloth-Inserted

 

SRP: Building Relationships through Converting Solutions Since 1951

We provide our customers with everything from material sampling and product prototyping to full manufacturing, packaging, and delivery. We provide value to our customers by delivering exceptional customer service, engineering solutions, and quality products to meet their every need.
description: SRP converts a variety of sheet rubber materials such as Neoprene, EPDM, Silicone and Nitrile into custom gaskets, seals and pads.
